metadata.title: CVE-2023-39322 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
QUIC connections do not set an upper bound on the amount of data bufferedwhen reading post-handshake messages, allowing a malicious QUIC connectionto cause unbounded memory growth. With fix, connections now consistentlyreject messages larger than 65KiB in size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.21 - 1.21.1-1~ubuntu22.04.1
golang-1.21-go - 1.21.1-1~ubuntu22.04.1
golang-1.21-src - 1.21.1-1~ubuntu22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.21 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.21.1-1~ubuntu22.04.1').
